publication.title: Obtaining Online Ecological Colourings by Generalizing First-Fit
publication.abstract: A colouring of a graph is ecological if every pair of vertices that have the same set of colours in their neighbourhood are coloured alike. We consider the following problem: if a graphG and an ecological colouringc ofG are given, can further vertices added to G, one at a time, be coloured so that at each stage the current graph

publication.title: The Computational Complexity of the Parallel Knock-Out Problem
publication.keyword: Bipartite Graph;Computational Complexity;Polynomial Time;Regular Graph;Knock Out;
publication.abstract: We consider computational complexity questions related to parallel knock-out schemes for graphs. In such schemes, in each round, each remaining vertex of a given graph eliminates exactly one of its neighbours. We show that the problem of whether, for a given bipartite graph, such a scheme can be found that eliminates every vertex is NP-complete. Moreover, we show that, for

publication.title: Upper Bounds and Algorithms for Parallel Knock-Out Numbers
publication.jconf: Colloquium on Structural Information & Communication Complexity

publication.title: Amalgamations of factorizations of complete equipartite graphs

publication.title: Path factors and parallel knock-out schemes of almost claw-free graphs
Defining sets for Latin squares given that they are based on groups
publication.abstract: We investigate deflning sets for latin squares where we are given that the latin square is the Cayley table for some group. Our main result is that the proportion of entries in a smallest deflning set approaches zero as the order of the group increases without bound.

publication.title: Amalgamations of connected k-factorizations
publication.authors: anthony j. w. hilton,christopher a. rodger,evan b. wantland
